author: V Venkatasubramanian
text:
The Model Code of Conduct officer, Manoharan reads out the rules at Kancheepuram Collectorate, on Monday —Photo: D. Gopalakrishnan

Wheelchairs will be made available at all polling booths to help senior citizens, who may have mobility-related problems.

The District Election Officer (DEO) and Kancheepuram Collector, R. Gajalakshmi made this announcement at an all-party meeting conducted here on Monday.

It was made after the political party representatives requested that vehicles carrying senior citizens should be allowed to enter the polling stations to help them reach the booths without any difficulty.

Pointing out that ramps were already available at all the buildings where polling booths would be set up, the DEO said that the provision of wheelchairs would make it easier for senior citizens to reach the polling station after alighting from vehicles and get back to the vehicles parked at a distance.

Sources said that so far wheelchair facility for senior citizens was restricted to model polling booths only.

MCC officer

Meanwhile, in the forthcoming Assembly elections, a government officer in the grade not less than that of a tahsildar will be posted as the officer for Model Code of Conduct in each district.

His primary work would be to explain the features of MCC and clarify which acts could be construed as a violation of the model code of conduct, to political party representatives as well as to voters.
title: Polling booths will have wheelchairs
